Initial commit: Beehive CLI with git worktree support

Implement complete Beehive CLI for managing multiple Claude Code agent
sessions in parallel using git worktrees for isolation.

Features:
- Git worktree-based architecture for true parallel execution
- Each agent runs in isolated workspace \(no branch conflicts\)
- tmux sessions for interactive and programmatic control
- Session lifecycle management \(create, list, attach, send, logs, status\)
- Automated PR creation via gh CLI
- File-based storage with concurrent access locking

Architecture:
- Uses git worktrees to create isolated workspaces per agent
- Each agent works in ~/.beehive/worktrees/beehive-<session-id>/
- Main repository stays untouched on original branch
- Multiple agents can work on same repo simultaneously

Core modules:
- session.py: Session data models and lifecycle management
- storage.py: File persistence with locking for concurrency
- tmux_manager.py: tmux session creation and control
- git_ops.py: Git operations including worktree management
- pr_creator.py: PR creation via gh CLI
- cli.py: Click-based CLI with 9 commands

Testing:
- 15 unit tests, all passing
- Comprehensive test coverage for core functionality

Documentation:
- README.md: Complete user guide with examples
- WORKTREES.md: In-depth worktree architecture guide
- QUICKSTART.md: 5-minute getting started
- INSTALL.md: Installation instructions
- CONTRIBUTING.md: Development guide
- WORKTREE_IMPLEMENTATION.md: Technical implementation details

This enables orchestrating unlimited Claude Code agents on the same
repository with zero conflicts - transforming sequential development
into true parallel AI-assisted development.
